page.title: 15Another Extract From 1945 1a
page.content:
NEWBRIDGE IN 1945 research by Sarah probert
In 1945 I had just turned 14 and I have left school.There were plenty of jobs around then so I had one straight away.It was in High Level.I had to lie on my stomach and shovel coal and the seam was only 2feet 6inches high and in some places I can remember it being a mere 18inches high,the pay was very poor but it was something.I gave all my pay to my mother as it was very hard to feed and cloth 9 children.I only had one set of clothes and I wore these everywhere,even on Sunday to Chapel.We used to go to the temple in Newbridge.I liked going to Chapel because in the summer they would organise trips to Barry and Porthcawl.
